sentence.Network_en: You cannot legislate to change attitudes.
sentence.Network_cn: 态度是不能用立法来改变的。

sentence.Network_en: The government will legislate against discrimination in the workplace.
sentence.Network_cn: 政府将制定法律，在工作场所禁止歧视。

sentence.Network_en: Parliament may legislate on any matter of penal law.
sentence.Network_cn: 议会可以对刑事法律的任何事项立法.

entry.def: When a government or state legislates, it passes a new law.

example.ex: Most member countries have already legislated against excessive overtime...
example.tran: 大多数成员国均已立法禁止超时加班。

example.ex: You cannot legislate to change attitudes.
example.tran: 态度是不能用立法来改变的。

means.word_mean: 1. make laws, bills, etc. or bring into effect by legislation;

sentences.sentence: "We cannot legislate how people's spend their free time"

auth_sentence.content: You can't legislate for the try they scored.
auth_sentence.res_content: You can't legislate for the try they scored.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: You can't legislate for the try they scored.

auth_sentence.content: The Government should legislate for standard quantities of wine.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Government should legislate for standard quantities of wine.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Government should legislate for standard quantities of wine.

auth_sentence.content: Each state will still be allowed to legislate marriage.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each state will still be allowed to legislate marriage.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each state will still be allowed to legislate marriage.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 法律[规];立法,法律的制定[或通过]
stems_affixes.word_buile: legislate[v.制定法律]+ion表名词→n.法律[规];立法,法律的制定[或通过]
legislate[v.制定法律]+ure表名词→n.立法机关

sentences.en: Congress has legislated a new minimum wage for workers.
sentences.cn: 国会制定了一项新的关于工人最低工资的法律。
